pButton.Name: WHAT?
pButton.popInfo: What is memory? Memory is the processes by which you store, encode, and recall information. Your memory is a collection of things that you have learned and know.

pButton.Name: WHY?
pButton.popInfo: Why is memory important? It’s important because knowledge has tremendous value. Knowledgeable people, in all professions, are sought after and paid well.

pButton.Name: HOW?
pButton.popInfo: How does memory work? The human brain has an incredible ability to process and store information. But only a small amount of acquired information is retained for future use. Everything in short-term memory is erased on a daily basis. As you sleep, the sub-conscious function of the brain selectively places important pieces of information into long-term memory. Most of what was in the short-term memory from the preceding day is classified as unimportant and forgotten.
